info.title: Crustdata API
info.description: Crustdata API definition. Please add your token in the `Authentication` section by clicking on `Auth Type` and selecting `Token`.

Token.name: Authorization
Token.description: Enter the token with the `Token` prefix, e.g. "Token abcde12345".

tags.name: Company APIs
tags.description: Allows you to query Crustdata's Company database to retrieve detailed information companies.

tags.name: People APIs
tags.description: Allows you to query Crustdata's People database to retrieve detailed professional information for a person.

tags.name: Watcher
tags.description: Allows you to create and manage watches for job postings, LinkedIn posts, new funding events, and more.

tags.name: Dataset APIs
tags.description: Endpoints for time series data, job listings, product launches, and additional analytics.

tags.name: Auxiliary APIs
tags.description: Helper endpoints that provide supporting functionality like autocomplete suggestions for other products.

tags.name: Web APIs
tags.description: Endpoints for web search and related functionality using search engine results.

post.description:
Identifies one or more companies in Crustdata's database based on the provided query parameters (e.g., domain, name). The API returns an array of matching companies, each with a matching score, sorted by relevance.

[Show Docs](/docs/discover/company-apis/company-identification-api)

200.description: Success response returning an array of matching companies

400.description: Bad request. Please check your request body.

404.description: Company not found in Crustdata's database.

get.description: Retrieve detailed company data using one or more identifiers. **At least one** of `company_domain`, `company_name`, `company_linkedin_url`, or `company_id` must be supplied.

200.description: The response provides a comprehensive profile of the company, including firmographic details, social media links, headcount data, and growth metrics.

400.description: Bad request, please check your request body to fix this error.

get.description:
Check your remaining API credits balance. You can use this to monitor your credit usage and ensure you have sufficient credits for your API requests.

[Show Docs](/docs/discover/auxiliary-apis/remaining-credits)

200.description: Successfully retrieved remaining credits

credits.description: The number of API credits remaining in your account

post.description:
Searches for company profiles on the web in real-time. Accepts a set of filters for search criteria. See [How to Build Filters](/docs/discover/company-apis/how-to-build-company-filters).

[Show Docs](/docs/discover/company-apis/company-search-api)

200.description: A JSON response containing a list of company profiles found and the total number of profiles available.

total_display_count.description: Short scale notation (like 1M+ or 1.5K) representing the total number of profiles available for the search.

400.description: Bad request, please check your request body to fix this error.

get.description:
Enrich data for one or more individuals using LinkedIn profile URLs or business email addresses. You must provide at least one of `linkedin_profile_url` or `business_email`. If `enrich_realtime` is set to true, and no matching record is found in the database, a real-time search will be performed.

[Show Docs](/docs/discover/people-apis/people-enrichment-api)

parameters.name: linkedin_profile_url
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of LinkedIn profile URLs.

parameters.name: business_email
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of business email addresses.

parameters.name: enrich_realtime
parameters.description: If set to true, performs a real-time search from the web if data is not found in the database.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to return.

200.description: Successful response

400.description: Bad request, please check your query parameters.

post.description:
Searches for people based on either a set of filters. - **Filters**: Provide an array of filter_type, type, and value. See [How to Build Filters](/docs/discover/people-apis/how-to-build-people-filters).

[Show Docs](/docs/discover/people-apis/people-search-api)

200.description: A JSON response containing a list of people profiles found and the total number of profiles available.

total_display_count.description: Short scale notation (like 1M+ or 1.5K) representing the total number of profiles available for the search.

400.description: Bad request, please check your request body to fix this error.

post.description:
In-database search API for people data, enabling you to search across millions of professional profiles with advanced filtering capabilities.

[Show Docs](/docs/discover/people-apis/people-discovery-api-in-db)

200.description: A JSON response containing a list of people profiles with pagination support.

400.description: Bad request, please check your request body to fix this error.

post.description:
In-database search API for company data, enabling you to search across millions of companies with advanced filtering capabilities and improved performance.

**Note:** This API is currently in beta and available by invitation only.

[Show Docs](/docs/discover/company-apis/company-discovery-api-in-db-v2)

high_growth_tech_startups.summary: Find high-growth tech startups with recent funding

200.description: A JSON response containing a list of companies with pagination support.

400.description: Bad request, please check your request body to fix this error.

post.description:
Get autocomplete suggestions for CompanyDB field values. Supports both nested and non-nested fields with fuzzy matching.

**Note:** This API is currently in beta and available by invitation only.

[Show Docs](/docs/discover/auxiliary-apis/companydb-autocomplete)

field.description: The field name to get suggestions for (e.g., "hq_country", "linkedin_industries")

query.description: Search text to get autocomplete suggestions

200.description: Successful response with autocomplete suggestions

suggestions.description: Array of suggested values for the field

400.description: Bad request

get.description:
Retrieve recent LinkedIn posts plus engagement metrics for either a **person** or a **company**, or fetch a **single post** by URL.

**Exactly one** of `person_linkedin_url`, `linkedin_post_url`, `company_domain`, `company_linkedin_url`, `company_name`, or `company_id` must be supplied.

[Show Docs (People API)](/docs/discover/people-apis/people-linkedin-post-api)
[Show Docs (Company API)](/docs/discover/company-apis/company-linkedin-post)

200.description: The response provides a list of recent LinkedIn posts for the specified company or person, including post content, engagement metrics, and information about users who interacted with the posts.

400.description: Bad request, please check your request body to fix this error.

post.summary: Realtime LinkedIn Post by Keyword API
post.description:
Search for LinkedIn posts containing specific keywords or phrases. Results can be sorted by relevance or recency and filtered by date posted.

[Show Docs](/docs/discover/company-apis/company-linkedin-post-by-keyword)

keyword.description: The keyword or phrase to search for in LinkedIn posts

page.description: Page number for pagination (starts from 1). Cannot be used when exact_keyword_match is true. Server default is 1 if not specified.

limit.description: Exact number of posts to return or scan. Required when exact_keyword_match is true.

exact_keyword_match.description: When true, returns posts that contain the exact keyword phrase. Must use 'limit' parameter instead of 'page' when enabled. The API will scan the first 'limit' posts and return only those containing exact matches.

date_posted.description: Filter posts by when they were posted

filters.description: Optional filters for posts by specific criteria

fields.description: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response. By default, returns core post data. Add "reactors" to fetch users who reacted, and "comments" to fetch comments.

max_reactors.description: Maximum number of reactors to fetch per post when "reactors" is included in fields. Range 0-5000. Server default is 5 if not specified.

max_comments.description: Maximum number of comments to fetch per post when "comments" is included in fields. Range 0-5000. Server default is 5 if not specified.

200.description: A list of LinkedIn posts matching the search criteria

total_count.description: Total number of posts matching the search criteria

400.description: Bad request. Check your request body.

examples: When 'exact_keyword_match' is true, pagination with 'page' is not supported. Please use 'limit' instead to specify how many posts to scan for exact matches.
No matching posts found. When using 'exact_keyword_match', the API searches within the first 'limit' posts. Try increasing the 'limit' parameter or use 'sort_by': 'relevance' for better results.

post.description:
Returns job listings along with pagination info, using the same fields-and-rows structure. You can optionally specify sync_from_source, date ranges, or keywords in the filters.

[Show Docs](/docs/discover/dataset-apis/dataset-job-listings-api)

200.description: Successful response containing fields and rows of job listings

400.description: Bad request

post.description:
⚠️ **Deprecation Notice**: This API will soon be deprecated. Please use `/screener/company` endpoint instead, which provides funding milestone timeseries data under the `funding_and_investment.funding_milestones_timeseries` section of the response. Returns a time-series of funding milestones for companies. Query using company_ids to get their funding history.

[Show Docs](/docs/discover/dataset-apis/dataset-funding-milestones-api)

filters.description: Filter conditions with op (and/or) and conditions array

200.description: Successful response containing funding milestone data

400.description: Bad request

get.description:
Retrieve portfolio details for a specified investor. Each investor has a unique identifier (UUID), name, and type. This API allows you to fetch the full portfolio of companies associated with an investor.

[Show Docs](/docs/discover/dataset-apis/dataset-investor-portfolio-api)

parameters.name: investor_uuid
parameters.description: Crunchbase UUID of the investor. Visit investor's Crunchbase page at https://crunchbase.com/organization/{investor_uuid}

200.description: Successful response containing investor portfolio data

400.description: Bad request - either investor_uuid OR investor_name must be provided, but not both

post.description:
Discover companies and get their ProductHunt launch data based on their ProductHunt launch performance.

[Show Docs](/docs/discover/dataset-apis/dataset-producthunt-api)

filters.description: Filter conditions with op (and/or) and conditions array

200.description: Successful response containing ProductHunt metrics data

400.description: Bad request

post.description:
Discover companies and get their Gartner review data based on their Gartner review performance.

[Show Docs](/docs/discover/dataset-apis/dataset-gartner-api)

filters.description: Filter conditions with op (and/or) and conditions array

200.description: Successful response containing Gartner review data

400.description: Bad request

post.description:
Creates a new watch for events, such as job postings, LinkedIn posts, or funding news. The `event_type_slug` indicates the type of event, while `event_filters` and `account_filters` define the conditions under which the watch triggers. Use `frequency` to decide how often you'd like to be notified, and `notification_endpoint` to specify a webhook or Slack endpoint, for example.

[Show Docs](/docs/discover/watcher-apis/watcher-overview#1-create-a-watch)

400.description: Bad request. Check your request body.

post.description:
Updates the status of an existing watch. E.g., from "active" to "paused" or "inactive."

[Show Docs](/docs/discover/watcher-apis/watcher-overview#2-update-watch)

parameters.name: watch_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the watch to update

200.description: Watch status updated

400.description: Bad request

post.description:
Simulates a watch without actually creating a new watch record, allowing you to see what results or events would be triggered.

[Show Docs](/docs/discover/watcher-apis/watcher-simulation)

200.description: Simulation results

400.description: Bad request

schema.description: Type of filter to get suggestions for
Maximum number of suggestions to return

200.description: Successfully retrieved autocomplete suggestions

400.description: Bad request - invalid parameters

results.description: Empty array when no suggestions found

post.description:
Get autocomplete suggestions for PersonDB field values. Supports both nested and non-nested fields with fuzzy matching.

[Show Docs](/docs/discover/auxiliary-apis/persondb-autocomplete)

field.description: The field name to get suggestions for (e.g., "region", "current_employers.name")

query.description: Search text to get autocomplete suggestions

200.description: Successfully retrieved autocomplete suggestions

suggestions.description: List of autocomplete suggestions for the field

suggestions: San Francisco County, California, United States
South San Francisco, California, United States

400.description: Bad request - invalid field or missing parameters

value.error: Field 'invalid_field' is not valid for autocomplete. Available fields are: certifications.issuer_organization, certifications.name, current_employers.company_headquarters_address, ...

post.description:
Performs a web search query using the browserscale API. Returns search results including titles, URLs, snippets, and positions.

[Show Docs](/docs/discover/web-apis/web-search)

parameters.name: fetch_content
parameters.description: When set to true, fetches the webpage content for all URLs returned by the search

searchMultipleSources.summary: Search both news and web sources

200.description: Successfully retrieved search results

results.title: Crustdata - B2B Data Platform
results.snippet: Crustdata provides high-quality B2B data and APIs for companies

results.title: Crustdata Documentation
results.snippet: Complete documentation for Crustdata APIs and services

successResponseWithContent.summary: Successful search response with fetched content

results.title: Ex-Twitter CEO Agrawal's AI search startup Parallel raises $100 million
results.snippet: AI startup Parallel Web Systems, founded by former Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal, has raised $100 million to build web search infrastructure for...

400.description: Invalid request parameters

value.error: Insufficient credits. Please get in touch with the Crustdata sales team.
Failed to connect to web search service

post.description:
Performs a web content fetch using the browserscale API. Returns webpage DOM content and title.

[Show Docs](/docs/discover/web-apis/web-fetch)

200.description: Successfully fetched web content

value.content:
Example Domain

This domain is for use in documentation examples without needing permission. Avoid use in operations.

Learn more

400.description: Invalid request payload

urls: This list may not be empty

value.error: Insufficient credits. Please get in touch with the Crustdata sales team.
Failed to connect to web search service

ProfessionalProfile.description: This object contains a detailed professional profile of a person.

EmploymentDetail.description: This object contains detail about a person's employment information.

Condition.description: This is a basic filter object which contains a column, a type and a value.

column.description: Specify the column to filter data based on your screening criteria.

type.description: Greater than or equal; Lesser than or equal; Equal; Lesser than, Greater than, Not equals, Exactly matches atleast one of the elements of list; Contains, case insensitive; Contains, case sensitive

value.description: Specify the value for the filter being applied.

ConditionGroup.description: This is a complex filter object which can contain a complex filter logic.

conditions.description: An array of complex filter objects or basic filter objects.

FilterGroup.description: This is a complex filter object which can contain a complex filter logic.

conditions.description: An array of complex filter objects or basic filter objects.

filters.description: You can create two types of filters. A Basic Filter or an advanced filter.

offset.description: The starting point of the result set. Default value is 0.

count.description: The number of results to return in a single request. Maximum value is 100. Default value is 100.

sorts.description: An array of sorting criteria. Each sort object must contain "column" and "order" fields.

column.description: The column name to sort by

filters.description:
Contains the primary filter logic for the request, including 
`linkedin_headcount_facet_name` for specifying the facet to query (e.g. "engineering").

offset.description: The starting index of the result set. Defaults to 0.

count.description: Number of results to return in one page. Maximum 100.

filters.description:
The primary filter logic, where you can specify columns such as
"linkedin_industries" with type = "(.)" and values like "biotech".

offset.description: Starting index of the result set. Defaults to 0.

count.description: How many results to return in a single response. Defaults to 100, max 100.

filters.description:
The primary filter logic. For example:
{ "op": "or", "conditions": [{"column": "company_id", "type": "in", "value": [632326]}]}

offset.description: The starting index of the result set. Defaults to 0.

count.description: Number of rows to return (must be <= 25).

decision_maker_titles.description: A list of job titles you want to filter on (e.g., co-founder).

InvestorPortfolioObject.description: Information about a specific investor and their portfolio

investments.description: List of companies funded by this investor

PortfolioInvestment.description: An object representing a single portfolio company plus the details of the investor's funding

investment_details.description: Detailed breakdown of each funding event

InvestmentDetails.description: Information about a single investment round

investment_amount_usd.description: Amount invested in USD (can be null)

funding_round.description: The name/type of the funding round, e.g. "Series A"

funding_round_investors.description: The list of investors who participated in this round

InvestorDetails.description: Basic info about an investor who participated in a round

name.description: Name of the investor (person or entity)

DataLabJobListingsRequest.description: Request payload for retrieving job listings from the data_lab job_listings dataset

count.description: Number of rows to return in this request

DataLabProductHuntRequest.description: Request payload for retrieving Product Hunt launch data

limit.description: Number of rows to return in the response

CompanyDetails.description: Summary info about the portfolio company

filters.description:
Each item contains filter_type, type, value. 
For details, see [How to Build Filters](/docs/discover/people-apis/how-to-build-people-filters).

filter_type.description: The filter to apply (e.g. FIRST_NAME, LAST_NAME, CURRENT_COMPANY, REGION, etc.)

page.description: The page number for pagination (starts from 1). Default is 1.

CompanyScreeningResponse.description: The response is JSON object that consists of two main components - fields and rows. The values in each of the rows elements are ordered in the same sequence as the fields in the fields array. For example, the ith value in a row corresponds to the ith field in the fields array.

fields.description: An array of objects representing the columns in the dataset.

rows.description: An array of arrays, each representing a row of data.

type.description: The data type of this column (e.g. foreign_key, string, array, etc.)

api_name.description: The internal or API-facing name for this column

rows.description: An array of data rows. Each row is itself an array of cell values in the same order as `fields`.

is_trial_user.description: Indicates if the current user is on a trial subscription

fields.description: An array describing the columns in the data set

type.description: The data type of this column (e.g. foreign_key, string, array)

api_name.description: Internal or API-facing name for the column

rows.description: Each element is an array of cell values, in the same order as `fields`.

is_trial_user.description: Indicates if this user is on a trial subscription

fields.description: An array describing the columns in the dataset

type.description: The data type (e.g., foreign_key, string, array)

rows.description: Each row is an array of values, in the same order as `fields`

is_trial_user.description: Indicates if the current user is on a trial subscription

rows.funding_milestone_investors: Kotak Investment Advisors,Kotak Alternate Asset Managers

type.description: The data type (e.g., foreign_key, string, array)

rows.description: Each row is an array of values, matching the order of `fields`

rows.name: Ion Stoica
rows.title: CEO,Co-Founder & Executive Chairman
rows.headline: Professor at UC Berkeley, Executive Chairman at Anyscale, Executive Chairman at Databricks

fields.description: Column definitions describing each field in the dataset

rows.description: Each element is an array of cell values, in the same order as `fields`.

is_trial_user.description: Whether the user is on a trial subscription

fields.description: An array of column definitions describing each field

rows.description: Each row is an array of cell values, in the same order as `fields`.

is_trial_user.description: Indicates if the user is on a trial subscription

rows: Make complex products clear, compelling, and unforgettable

linkedin_profile_url.description: URL of the individual's LinkedIn profile.

linkedin_profile_urn.description: Unique identifier for the LinkedIn profile.

default_position_title.description: Title of the individual's current position.

default_position_company_linkedin_id.description: LinkedIn ID of the company where the individual holds their default position.

default_position_is_decision_maker.description: Indicates if the individual is a decision maker in their current position.

flagship_profile_url.description: URL of the flagship LinkedIn profile.

profile_picture_url.description: URL of the individual's profile picture (can be null).

summary.description: Summary of the individual's professional experience.

num_of_connections.description: Number of LinkedIn connections the individual has.

related_colleague_company_id.description: LinkedIn ID of a related colleague's company.

skills.description: List of skills possessed by the individual.

title.description: Job title of the individual at the company.

end_date.description: End date of employment (can be null if currently employed).

description.description: Description of the role (can be null).

items.description: Media related to the job (currently empty).

degree_name.description: Name of the degree obtained (can be null).

emails.description: List of email addresses associated with the individual.

websites.description: List of personal or professional websites.

twitter_handle.description: Twitter username of the individual (can be null).

languages.description: List of languages spoken by the individual.

pronoun.description: Preferred pronouns of the individual (can be null).

current_title.description: Current job title of the individual.

filters.description: Filter conditions for searching people. Can be a simple condition or complex nested conditions with AND/OR logic.

cursor.description: Pagination cursor from previous response. Used for fetching the next page of results.

limit.description: The number of results to return in a single request. Default value is 20. Maximum is 1,000.

post_processing.description: Additional filtering options applied to search results.

exclude_profiles.description: List of LinkedIn profile URLs to exclude from results.

exclude_names.description: List of names to exclude from results.

PersonDBCondition.description: Basic filter condition for PersonDB search

type.description: The operator to use for comparison. Use (.) for fuzzy text matching.

PersonDBConditionGroup.description: Complex filter group for PersonDB search with AND/OR logic

profiles.description: Array of person profiles matching the search criteria

next_cursor.description: Cursor for fetching the next page of results

total_count.description: Total number of profiles matching the search criteria

profile_picture_permalink.description: Permanent URL of the profile picture

recently_changed_jobs.description: Indicates if the person recently changed jobs

last_updated.description: When the profile was last updated in the database

updated_at.description: When the profile data was last refreshed

associated_organization_linkedin_id.description: LinkedIn ID of the associated organization

url.description: URL to verify or view the certification

issuer_organization_linkedin_id.description: LinkedIn ID of the issuing organization

linkedin_profile_url.description: URL of the company's LinkedIn profile.

company_twitter_url.description: URL of the company's Twitter profile.

company_website_domain.description: Domain name of the company's website.

hq_country.description: Country where the company's headquarters are located.

largest_headcount_country.description: Country where the company has the largest number of employees.

hq_street_address.description: Street address of the company's headquarters.

fiscal_year_end.description: Month in which the company's fiscal year ends.

linkedin_company_description.description: Description of the company from its LinkedIn profile.
examples: HubSpot is a leading CRM platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better.

acquisition_status.description: Whether the company has been acquired by another company. (null in this example)

markets.description: Stock exchanges where the company's stock is traded.

Taxonomy.title: Taxonomy
Taxonomy.description: Classifies the company across various categories

competitor_website_domains.description: Website domains of paid SEO competitors

paid_seo_competitors_website_domains.description: Website domains of paid SEO competitors

organic_seo_competitors_website_domains.description: Website domains of organic SEO competitors

HeadCount.title: Headcount
HeadCount.description: Information about the company employee count

filters.description: Filter conditions for searching companies. Can be a simple condition or complex nested conditions with AND/OR logic.

cursor.description: Pagination cursor from previous response. Used for fetching the next page of results.

limit.description: The number of results to return in a single request. Default value is 20. Maximum is 1,000.

CompanyDBCondition.description: Basic filter condition for CompanyDB search

type.description: The operator to use for comparison. Use (.) for fuzzy text matching, [.] for exact token matching.

CompanyDBConditionGroup.description: Complex filter group for CompanyDB search with AND/OR logic

companies.description: Array of companies matching the search criteria

next_cursor.description: Cursor for fetching the next page of results

hq_street_address_and_city.description: Street address and city of headquarters

estimated_revenue_lower_bound_usd.description: Estimated minimum annual revenue in USD

estimated_revenue_higher_bound_usd.description: Estimated maximum annual revenue in USD

last_funding_round_investment_usd.description: Amount raised in last funding round in USD

growth_calculation_date.description: Date when growth metrics were calculated

IdentifyRequest.description:
Request body for the Company Identification API.
You only need to supply one of the five identifier fields
(`query_company_name`, `query_company_website`,
 `query_company_linkedin_url`, `query_company_crunchbase_url`, `query_company_id`).

query_company_linkedin_url.description: LinkedIn profile URL of the company.

query_company_crunchbase_url.description: Crunchbase profile URL of the company.

count.description: Maximum number of results to return. Server default is 10 if not specified.

CompanyEnrichmentStatusEnriching.description: An array of objects describing companies currently under enrichment.

message.example: The following companies will be enriched in the next 24 hours

companies.description: A list of companies pending enrichment

identifier.description: Identifier for the company (e.g. domain or LinkedIn URL)

CompanyEnrichmentStatusNotFound.description: An array of objects describing companies that could not be found even after enrichment.

status.description: Status indicating the company was not found

message.example: The requested company was not found and no data is available

companies.description: A list of companies for which data could not be found

identifier.description: Identifier for the company (e.g. domain or LinkedIn URL)

CreateWatchResponse.description: Response after creating a new watch

id.description: ID of the newly created watch

headline.example: Co-founder at Crustdata (YC F24) | Real-time B2B data for AI agents

enriched_realtime.description: Indicates if the profile was enriched in real-time

dataset.description: An object containing the dataset name and id.

filters.description: An object containing the filter conditions.

offset.description: The starting point of the result set. Default value is 0.

limit.description: The number of results to return in a single request. Maximum value is 100. Default value is 100.

aggregations.description: [Optional] List of column objects you want to aggregate on with aggregate type

functions.description: [Optional] List of functions you want to apply

groups.description: [Optional] List of group by you want to apply

fields.description: An array of objects representing the columns in the dataset.

type.description: The data type of this column (e.g. string, number, date).

api_name.description: The API name for this column.

rows.description: An array of arrays, each representing a row of data. The values in each of the rows elements correspond directly to the fields in the `fields` array.

is_trial_user.description: Indicates if the current user is on a trial subscription.

CompanyName.name: company_name
CompanyName.description: Comma-separated list (max 25) of company names. If a name itself contains a comma, wrap it in double quotes.

CompanyLinkedInURL.name: company_linkedin_url
CompanyLinkedInURL.description: Comma-separated list (max 25) of LinkedIn company profile URLs.

CompanyID.name: company_id
CompanyID.description: Comma-separated list (max 25) of Crustdata company IDs.

Fields.name: fields
Fields.description: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response (supports dot-notation for nested fields).

EnrichRealtime.name: enrich_realtime
EnrichRealtime.description:
When **true** and a company isn't in the DB,
Crustdata enriches it within ~10 minutes. Default: **false**.

ExactMatch.name: exact_match
ExactMatch.description:
If **true**, identifiers must match exactly;
if **false**, best-match logic applies. Default: **false**.

PersonLinkedInURL.name: person_linkedin_url
PersonLinkedInURL.description:
LinkedIn profile URL of the person.
Flagship (`https://linkedin.com/in/name`) or FSD (`.../in/ACoAAA...`) formats are both accepted.

LinkedInPostURL.name: linkedin_post_url
LinkedInPostURL.description:
URL of a specific LinkedIn post to fetch.
Use this to retrieve a single post by its URL instead of fetching posts for a person/company.
Expected format: `https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:` or `https://www.linkedin.com/posts/`

PostPage.name: page
PostPage.description: Page number for pagination (starts from 1, max 20).

PostFields.name: fields
PostFields.description: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response.

PostMaxReactors.name: max_reactors
PostMaxReactors.description: Maximum reactors to fetch per post (people posts only, 1-5000).

PostMaxComments.name: max_comments
PostMaxComments.description: Maximum comments to fetch per post (people posts only, 1-5000).

sources.description: List of search sources to query.

contents.description: Array of fetched webpage content (only present when fetch_content=true)

success.description: Whether the content was fetched successfully

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp when content was fetched

content.description: The HTML content of the webpage

title.description: The title of the search result

url.description: The URL of the search result

snippet.description: A snippet/description from the search result
snippet.example: Crustdata provides high-quality B2B data and APIs for companies

position.description: The position of the result in the search

searchTime.description: Time taken to perform the search in seconds

userAgent.description: User agent string used for the search

urls.description: List of URLs to fetch web content for

success.description: Whether the content was fetched successfully

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp when content was fetched

content.description: The HTML content of the webpage
